verses.verse: {The Servant of the Lord} d "Listen to me, you coastlands! Pay {So 1QIsa a LXX; 1QIsa b MT read and pay} attention, you people {Lit. peoples ; i. e. non-Israelis then in the land} from far away! The Lord called me from the womb; while I was still in my mother's body, he pronounced my name.

He made my mouth like a sharp sword; he hid me in the shadow of his hands. {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT LXX read hand} He made me like a polished arrow and hid me away in his quivers. {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b 4QIsa d MT LXX read quiver}
He said to me: «You are my servant, Israel, in whom I will glorify myself.'

"I {So 1QIsa a ; 4QIsa d MT LXX read But I} said: «I've labored for nothing. I've exhausted my strength on futility and on {So 1QIsa a LXX; 1QIsa b MT lack on} emptiness.'Yet surely my recompense is with the Lord , and my reward is with my God.

"And now, says the Lord, who formed you {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT LXX me} from the womb as his servant to bring Jacob back to him so that Israel might be gathered {So 1QIsa a MT qere LXX; 4QIsa d MT might not be gathered (misspelling)} to him and I am honored in the Lord's sight and my God has been my help {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT LXX strength}

he says: "It is too small a thing for you to be my servant, to raise up the tribes of Israel {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT LXX Jacob} and bring back those of Jacob {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT LXX Israel} I have preserved. I'll also make you as a light to the nations, to be my salvation to the ends {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT LXX end} of the earth.

"This is what my Lord {So 1QIsa a 1QIsa b ; MT LXX lacks my Lord} says the Lord your Redeemer, O Israel, {So 1QIsa a LXX; 1QIsa b MT read the Redeemer of Israel} and his Holy One to one despised by people, {So 1QIsa a 4QIsa d ; MT CaiGen LXX reads to one people despise} to those abhorred {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX reads one abhorred} as a nation, to the servant of rulers: "Kings see {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT read Kings will see ; LXX reads Kings will see him} and arise, and princes {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b reads They will rise ; MT LXX read princes will rise, and they} will bow down, because of the Lord who is faithful, the Holy One of Israel, the one who has {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads and the one who has ; LXX reads and I have} chosen you."

{The Restoration of Israel} d "This what the Lord says: "I'll answer {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX reads I have answered} you in a time of favor, and on a day of salvation I'll help {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT LXX read I have helped} you. I have watched over you, and given you as a covenant for the people, to restore the land, to reassign the inheritances that have been devastated;

saying to captives, «Come out!'and {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT lack and} to those who are in darkness, «Be free!'{Or darkness, «Show yourselves!'} "They will feed on all the mountains, {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads by the roads ; LXX reads in all their roads} and their pasture will be on all the barren hills.
They won't hunger or thirst, nor will the desert heat or sun beat upon them; for the one who has compassion on them will drive them and guide them alongside springs of water.
I'll turn all my mountains into a road, and my highways will be raised up.
"Watch! They'll come from far away some from the north and from the west, and others from the Aswan region." {Lit. Syenes ; so 1QIsa a ; MT reads Syene ; LXX reads Persians}

Shout with joy, you heavens, and rock with glee, you earth! Break out in song, you mountains! {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX read Let the mountains break out ; MT qere, mss read And break out, you mountains} The Lord is comforting {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX read has comforted} his people and will have compassion on his afflicted ones.
{Zion Not Forgotten} d "But Zion said, «The Lord has abandoned me, and my God {So 1QIsa a corrector; Lit. my God written above my Lord ; MT LXX read my Lord} has forgotten me.'
"Can a woman forget her nursing child, or have no compassion for the child of her womb? Even these mothers may forget; But as for me, I'll never forget you!
Look! I've inscribed you on the palms of my hands, and {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX read and} your walls are forever before me.
Your builders {So 1QIsa a Aquila Vulg LXX; MT reads sons} are working faster than your destroyers, and those who devastated you go away from you.

Lift up your eyes and look around they have all gathered together and are coming to you. "As surely as I live,"says the Lord , "you will clothe yourself with all of them like ornaments, and tie them on like a bride.
Indeed, your ruins, your desolate places, and your devastated land will now be too crowded for your inhabitants, while those who swallowed you up will be far away.
"The children who are grieving at present {Lit. children of your bereavement} will yet say in your hearing, «This place is too crowded for me; make room for me, so I may have a place to live.'

Then you'll ask {Lit. say} in your heart, «Who bore these children for me, although I was childless and barren, and {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX lack and} an exile {LXX lacks and an exile} and cast aside? Who {So 1QIsa a . MT LXX read And who} brought these up? Look! {So 1QIsa a MT; LXX lacks Look!} For my part I was left all alone; but as for these, where have they come from? '

"For {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX lack For} this what the Lord {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT reads my Lord the Lord} says, «Watch! I'll lift up my hand to the nations and raise my banner to the {So 1QIsa a ; MT lacks the} peoples. {So 1QIsa a MT; LXX reads islands} They will bring your sons in their arms, and your daughters will be carried on their shoulders.'

"Oh, yes! {Or And aha! ; so 1QIsa a cf. Isa 55:1; MT LXX read And it will happen that} Kings will be your foster fathers, and their queens will be your nursing mothers. They will bow to you with their faces to the ground, and lick the dust from your feet. Then you will know that I am the Lord ; those who hope in me will not be disappointed.

"Can they seize plunder {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT reads plunder be seized} from warriors, or {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT lacks or} can the captives of tyrants {So 1QIsa a LXX Targ Vulg; MT reads righteous ones} be rescued?

But this is what the Lord says: "He will seize {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT reads will be seized ;} even the warriors'plunder, {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX reads captives} and the captives {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX reads plunder} of tyrants will be rescued. I myself will quarrel with those who have a quarrel with you, {So 1QIsa a ; MT Vulg read with your contender ; LXX reads your cause} and I myself will save your children.

"I'll make those who mistreat you {So 1QIsa a probably misspells this word as I will eat .} eat their own flesh, and they will get drunk on their own blood, as with new wine. "Then all mankind will know that I am the Lord your Savior and your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob."
